intro: Acidanthera sabulosa, commonly known as the sand orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with a distinctive spurred petal. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Acidanthera sabulosa is typically found in open habitats such as coastal dunes or rocky outcrops.
